intro: Castilleja hispida var. acuta, commonly known as the roughleaf milkvetch, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Castilleja hispida var. acuta plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinator populations.
